originalTitle: South African farmers fear devastation as foot-and-mouth takes hold
title: Oh Dear, Our Cows Are Sick!
content:
Hello, Little Friends from Africa!

Hello everyone! It's your kid-friendly reporter here, bringing you news from our beautiful continent, Africa. Today, we have a story from South Africa. It's about some very special animals that give us yummy milk and sometimes even food: our cows! Sadly, some cows are not feeling well right now. They have a sickness that grown-ups call "foot-and-mouth disease." Don't worry, we're going to talk about it simply, and learn what grown-ups are doing to help our cow friends.

What is Foot-and-Mouth Disease?

Foot-and-mouth disease is a tricky name, isn't it? But it simply means a sickness that makes cows, and other animals like goats and pigs, feel very unwell. It's like when you get a cold or a flu, but it's only for animals. People cannot get this sickness from cows, so you don't need to be scared. It just makes the animals very, very tired and sore.

Did you know? This sickness only makes animals like cows, sheep, and pigs sick. It cannot make humans sick! So you can still enjoy your milk and cheese.

How Does It Make Cows Sick?

Imagine you have little blisters, like small bumps, on your feet and in your mouth. That's how it is for the cows! When cows get foot-and-mouth disease, they get little sores on their feet. This makes it very hard for them to walk. Ouch! They also get sores inside their mouths and on their tongues. This makes it super painful for them to eat their yummy grass or drink water. So, the cows feel very weak and sad.

Why Are Cows Important?

Cows are super important helpers on farms. They give us lots of delicious milk, which we drink and use to make cheese, yogurt, and butter! Many farmers also raise cows for their meat, which helps to feed many families. When cows are healthy and happy, they can give us all these good things. They are a big part of how farmers make a living and how many people get their food.

Did you know? In some parts of Africa, cows are so special that they are like family! Their milk helps kids grow strong, and they are cared for very much.

What Happens When Cows Get Sick?

When cows get this sickness, many sad things happen. First, they stop wanting to eat because their mouths hurt. They stop wanting to walk because their feet hurt. This means they cannot give milk anymore. A mom cow cannot feed her baby calf. Farmers also worry a lot because if their cows are sick, they cannot sell their milk or help provide food. It makes the farmers very worried and sad because their animals are suffering and they might not have enough money.

Farmers Are Sad

Imagine you have a pet that gets very sick. You would feel very sad and worried, right? That's how farmers feel about their cows. Farmers in South Africa work very hard every day to look after their animals. They love their cows. When their cows get this foot-and-mouth disease, it makes the farmers very, very sad. They are scared that many of their cows might get sick, or even worse, that they might lose their cows. It's a very tough time for them.

What Are Grown-Ups Doing To Help?

When something bad like this happens, grown-ups try their best to help. The grown-ups in charge, called the government, are working hard to stop the sickness from spreading. They want to protect all the healthy cows. They are trying to find the sick cows and make sure they don't share the sickness with other cows. It's like when you have a cold, and your mom tells you to stay home so your friends don't get sick too.

Giving Medicine to Cows! (Vaccination)

One very important thing the grown-ups are doing is giving special medicine to the cows. This medicine is called a "vaccination." It's like a tiny magic shot that helps the cows' bodies learn how to fight off the sickness before they even get it. Think of it like a superhero shield for the cows! The government has started a big plan to give these vaccinations to many cows in South Africa. This will help make the cows strong against the disease.

Did you know? Vaccinations are very clever! They teach your body how to fight off tiny sickness bugs, so you don't get very ill. We have vaccinations for many sicknesses too!

A Little Bit Slow, But Helping Now

Some people feel that the grown-ups started giving this special medicine a little bit late. It's like when you start a race, and maybe you don't run as fast as you should at the very beginning. But now, they are running very fast to help! They are working hard to catch up and make sure all the cows that need the medicine get it quickly. It's important to act fast so fewer cows get sick. They are trying their very best now to protect our farm friends.

Why This Matters To All of Us

You might think, "Why is this news important to me?" Well, because cows give us so much! If many cows get sick, there might be less milk for us to drink, and maybe less meat for our food. This could make food a little more expensive for our parents. So, when our cow friends are healthy, it helps all of us have good, healthy food on our tables. It helps our farmers too, who work so hard for us.

Let's Hope For Our Animal Friends!

So, while our cow friends in South Africa are having a tough time, many grown-ups are working very hard to help them. They are giving special medicine, keeping sick cows separate, and trying to stop the sickness. Let's send our happy thoughts to the farmers and their cows, hoping they all get better soon and stay healthy. It shows how important it is to look after our animals and help each other. We are all together in this!
summary: Cows in South Africa are sick with a disease that hurts their feet and mouths, making farmers worried, but grown-ups are now giving special medicine to help them get better.
whyMatters: It's important because healthy cows give us milk and food, and help farmers take care of their families and provide for everyone.

originalTitle: Tunisian MP jailed for eight months over posts mocking president
title: A Big Story About Speaking Up in Tunisia
content:
Hey there, super curious kids from all over Africa! It's your friendly news reporter, here to share a story from a beautiful country called Tunisia. Tunisia is in North Africa, where the sun shines bright and the Mediterranean Sea sparkles!

A Special Place Called Tunisia

Imagine a country with sandy beaches, ancient ruins, and yummy food. That's Tunisia! It's a land full of friendly people and interesting history. Just like your country has a leader, Tunisia has one too.

Who is a President?

In Tunisia, like many countries, there is a special person called the President. Think of the President as the head helper of the whole country. Their job is to make sure everyone is safe and happy. They help make important decisions, like building schools, hospitals, and keeping the country fair for everyone. It's a very big job! Did you know? A President is like the captain of a big ship, guiding the country forward!

What is an MP?

Now, let's talk about another important helper, called an MP. MP stands for "Member of Parliament." That's a long name, so let's call them "community helpers." An MP is a person chosen by the people in their local area. They are like a special messenger for their community. They listen to what the people in their town or village need. Do they need better roads? More clean water? A new playground? The MP takes these ideas and talks about them in a big meeting place called the Parliament. The Parliament is where many MPs meet to talk about rules and problems for the whole country. They work hard to make sure their community's voice is heard. Did you know? In many countries, people vote to choose who their MP will be! Voting means you choose your favorite person to help make decisions.

When Too Much Water Comes

Sometimes, nature can be a bit tricky. In Tunisia, just like in many places, there were very big rainfalls. When it rains too much, too quickly, the rivers and streets can get full of water. This is called a flood. Floods can be very scary. They can cover roads, homes, and even farms. People need help to stay safe and fix their homes after a flood. When floods happen, the President and the MPs, and other helpers, work together to make sure everyone gets the help they need. They send out rescue teams and try to make things better quickly. Did you know? Some places in Africa have very heavy rainy seasons, and floods can happen there too. It's important to listen to grown-ups during big storms!

Speaking Up for People

Now, here's where our story gets interesting. There was an MP in Tunisia. Remember, an MP's job is to speak for their community. This MP saw the floods and how people were struggling. Maybe they felt that the government, and perhaps the President, was not helping fast enough or well enough. So, this MP decided to share their thoughts. They used the internet, maybe a social media page, to write about what they thought. They wrote things that made fun of, or "mocked," the President's way of dealing with the floods. Mocking means making jokes or saying things that show you think someone is doing a bad job. It can sometimes hurt feelings or be disrespectful. When you speak up, it means you share your ideas. It's good to share ideas and talk about how to make things better. But sometimes, how you speak up can be tricky. Did you know? Sharing your ideas and feelings is very important, but it's also important to be kind and respectful when you do it!

What Happened Next?

Because the MP made fun of the President in a public way, something serious happened. The MP was arrested. To be arrested means that someone is taken by the police because they might have broken a rule or a law. After being arrested, the MP had to go to court. A court is where judges listen to both sides of a story and decide if someone broke a rule. It's like when a teacher helps solve a problem between friends. In this case, the judge said that the MP had broken a rule by mocking the President in their posts. The judge decided it was a serious enough act to have consequences. So, the judge said the MP would be jailed for eight months. Being jailed means they have to stay in a special place, like a prison, for a certain time. This is a punishment for breaking a serious rule. It means they cannot go home or do their job as an MP for a while.

Why Are Rules Important?

This might make you think: "Why can't people just say whatever they want?" That's a great question! In many countries, people have "freedom of speech." This means they can usually say what they think and share their ideas. It's a very important freedom because it helps everyone know what is happening and how to make things better. It lets people share their worries and hopes. But even with freedom of speech, there are still rules. Just like in your school, you can talk to your friends, but you can't shout mean things or spread untrue stories. Laws are like big rules for the whole country. They are there to keep everyone safe and to make sure things are fair. Sometimes, leaders and governments have rules about what people can say, especially about them. The idea is to keep things orderly and respectful. But it can be a tricky balance. People want to share their thoughts, and leaders want respect. It's something that countries often talk about. Did you know? Different countries have different rules about freedom of speech. It's like how different games have different rules!

Learning Together

So, what does this story teach us? It teaches us that being a leader, like a President or an MP, is a very big responsibility. It also teaches us that speaking up for what you believe in is important. But it also reminds us that there are rules. Even big community helpers like MPs must follow rules. And sometimes, what one person thinks is okay to say, another person might think is not okay. This story shows us that talking about problems and finding solutions is part of living in a country together. We all want our communities and countries to be safe, fair, and happy. And sometimes, working out how to speak up and how to listen is a very important part of that journey. Let's always remember to be kind, thoughtful, and to try to understand each other, even when we don't agree. That's how we build strong, happy communities, everywhere in Africa and the world!
summary: An MP (community helper) in Tunisia was jailed for eight months because they made fun of the President's handling of floods, showing us that speaking up is important but comes with rules.
whyMatters: This story helps us understand that leaders have big jobs, and while it's good to share our ideas, there are rules about how we speak up, even for community helpers.

originalTitle: Son of Robert Mugabe arrested in South Africa on suspicion of attempted murder
title: A Big Story from South Africa: What Happened to Bellarmine Mugabe?
content:
Hey there, amazing explorers of Africa! It's your friendly news reporter, here to share a story from a big, beautiful country called South Africa. Sometimes, news can be a bit tricky, but don't worry, we'll learn all about it together, in easy-peasy steps! Today, we're going to talk about something that happened with a person named Bellarmine Mugabe. He's a grown-up, and he was visiting South Africa. Something not so good happened, and the police are working very hard to find out exactly what happened. Let's find out more!

Who is Bellarmine Mugabe?

First, let's learn a little bit about Bellarmine Mugabe. His dad was a very important person in a country next door to South Africa. That country is called Zimbabwe. His dad, Robert Mugabe, was a leader there for a long time. So, Bellarmine comes from a very well-known family in this part of Africa. Think of it like someone famous in your town, or someone whose family is well-known. Bellarmine was visiting South Africa, just like many people travel between countries in Africa for holidays, work, or to see family and friends. He was staying in a place there, enjoying his time. Did you know? South Africa is famous for its amazing wildlife, like lions, elephants, and giraffes! People from all over the world love to visit its national parks, like Kruger National Park.

What Happened in South Africa?

Now, for the important part of our story. While Bellarmine Mugabe was staying in South Africa, something really sad happened. A man who worked at the very place where Bellarmine was staying got hurt. This man was shot. When someone is 'shot,' it means a very fast object, like a tiny bullet, comes out of a special tool called a gun. This fast object can hit someone and hurt them very, very badly. It's a loud noise, and it can cause a lot of pain and injuries. It is very dangerous and not a good thing to happen to anyone. The man was injured, which means he got hurt. We don't want anyone to get hurt, do we? Everyone deserves to be safe and sound, especially when they are doing their work. The police had to step in quickly to understand what went wrong and to help.

What Does 'Arrested' Mean?

Because the man got hurt at the place where Bellarmine was, the police needed to talk to Bellarmine. The police 'arrested' him. What does 'arrested' mean? It doesn't mean someone is bad or guilty right away. It means the police take them to the police station. They take them to the station so they can ask them lots of questions. It's like when your teacher asks you to come and talk to them if something happens in the classroom. The police want to hear Bellarmine's side of the story and find out everything he knows. When someone is 'in custody,' it means the police are holding them. They stay with the police while they are being asked questions and while the police gather more information. This helps the police to make sure everyone is safe and to properly investigate what happened. It's a very important step for the police to do their job properly.

What is 'Suspicion of Attempted Murder'?

This part sounds a bit serious, so let's break it down into easy words. Bellarmine was arrested on 'suspicion of attempted murder.' 'Suspicion' means the police *think* something might have happened, and they *think* someone might be involved, but they are not 100% sure yet. They have some ideas, but they need to do more investigating to find out the truth. It's like when you suspect your friend took the last biscuit, but you haven't seen them do it! 'Attempted murder' is a very serious thing. 'Murder' means trying to make someone die. 'Attempted murder' means someone *tried* to make another person die, but that person did not die. Luckily, the man who was shot was only injured, not killed. But trying to hurt someone so badly is against the law and is very, very wrong. The police are investigating to see if Bellarmine might have tried to do this. Did you know? In many African cultures, people believe in 'ubuntu,' which means 'I am because we are.' It's all about kindness, community, and looking after each other. Hurting someone goes against this wonderful idea!

The Police and Justice System: Finding the Truth

The police have a very important job. Their job is to keep everyone safe and to make sure that people follow the rules, which we call 'laws.' When something bad happens, like someone getting hurt, the police start to 'investigate.' To 'investigate' means they look for clues, like a detective in a storybook! They talk to people who saw what happened, they look at the place where it happened, and they try to put all the pieces of the puzzle together. Their goal is to find out the truth. After the police investigate, they will take all their information to a 'court.' A court is a special place where a 'judge' or other important grown-ups listen to everyone's story. They listen to what the police found, and they listen to what the person who was arrested has to say. Then, the judge helps to decide what should happen next, based on the laws. Everyone gets a chance to tell their side of the story. Did you know? South Africa has 11 official languages! That means people speak many different languages like Zulu, Xhosa, Afrikaans, and English!

Why Is This News Important for Us?

Stories like this, even though they can be a bit serious, teach us important things. They remind us that laws are very important. Laws help us all live together safely and happily. If people don't follow the laws, others can get hurt. This story also shows us that everyone, no matter who their family is, or how famous their dad was, must follow the rules. No one is above the law. We all have to be responsible for our actions. And it teaches us patience. We don't know the full story yet. The police are still working, and we should wait for them to finish their job before we make up our minds. It's important not to jump to conclusions, but to let the grown-ups who are experts do their work to find the real truth.

What Happens Next?

So, what will happen next in this story? The police in South Africa will keep investigating. They will gather more clues and talk to more people. Bellarmine Mugabe might have to go to court, where a judge will listen to everything. We will keep listening too, and when there's more news, your friendly African news reporter will be right here to tell you! For now, remember to be kind, be safe, and always follow the rules. That's how we make our communities strong and happy places for everyone to live. Thank you for being such smart listeners! Stay tuned for more amazing news and stories from our wonderful continent of Africa!
summary: Bellarmine Mugabe, the son of a former leader in Zimbabwe, was arrested in South Africa because police suspect he might have tried to hurt a man who worked where he was staying.
whyMatters: This story is important because it shows us that everyone must follow the rules and laws, no matter who they are, and that the police work hard to keep people safe and find out the truth when something bad happens.

originalTitle: Trump says world has 10 days to see if Iran agrees deal or 'bad things happen'
title: Big Leaders Talk About Making The World Safe!
content:
Hello, super friends! Your friend reporter here, bringing you some important news from far, far away. Sometimes, big leaders from different countries talk about important things. They want to make sure everyone in the world is safe and happy. Today, we're talking about leaders from a country called America and another country called Iran. 

### Hello from Far Away Lands!

Imagine you are playing with your friends. Sometimes, you need to talk about rules for a game, right? Maybe you want to share a toy, and you need to agree on who plays first. Well, big countries are a bit like that! Their leaders need to talk and agree on things to make sure everyone is safe and happy in the whole world.

One of these big leaders we are talking about today is Mr. Donald Trump. He was once the leader, called the President, of a very big country far away. This country is called America, or the United States. It's a land with tall buildings, big cities, and lots of different people, just like our beautiful Africa has many amazing places and people!

*   **Did you know?** The United States is so big that it has many different kinds of weather, from very cold snow to sunny beaches!

### Meeting Iran: A Country Far Away

Now, let's learn about another country called Iran. Iran is also a very old country, with many amazing stories and a rich history. It is in a place called the Middle East. That sounds far, doesn't it? It's a place with deserts and beautiful old cities.

Sometimes, leaders from America and Iran have different ideas about things. It's like when you and your friend might want to play different games. But it's important for everyone to talk and try to understand each other. That's how we make friends and solve problems, isn't it?

*   **Did you know?** The Middle East is home to some of the world's oldest cities, where people have lived for thousands of years!

### What Are They Talking About? Special Energy!

The leaders are talking about something called a "nuclear programme." Wow, that sounds like a very big word! Let's make it simple.

Imagine energy. Energy is what makes things go! It makes our lights turn on, it helps cars move, and it even helps our bodies run when we play and learn. There is a special kind of energy, super-duper strong energy, that comes from tiny, tiny parts of everything around us. It's called nuclear energy.

This special energy can be used for amazing good things! For example, it can make a lot of electricity. Electricity is what powers our homes, our schools, and our hospitals. It helps us see in the dark, learn on computers, and keeps our food cold. So, using this special energy for electricity is a really good idea!

But, this super strong energy can also be used for other things, like making very powerful tools or weapons. And when countries make very powerful weapons, it can make people around the world feel a bit worried. Nobody wants to feel worried, right? Everyone wants to feel safe.

*   **Did you know?** The sun, which gives us light and warmth every day, makes its energy using a kind of nuclear power!

### What Is a "Deal" or an "Agreement"?

So, Mr. Trump and other leaders want to make a "deal" with Iran. What is a deal? It's like a promise or an agreement. It's when people talk and say, "Okay, we agree to do this, and you agree to do that."

For example, maybe you make a deal with your brother or sister: "I will help you clean up, if you help me finish my homework." That's a deal! Everyone agrees to something, and it helps everyone.

In this case, the deal is about making sure that Iran only uses this special, super strong energy for good things, like making electricity for homes and schools. They want to make sure it's not used to make any powerful weapons that could make people feel scared.

Leaders want to agree on rules, just like we have rules in our classroom or at home. Rules help everyone stay safe and be happy together.

*   **Did you know?** In many African countries, leaders come together to make deals about sharing water, helping each other, and making sure everyone in Africa can live in peace!

### Why Are Soldiers Going to the Middle East?

The news also says that America is "surging forces" to the Middle East. That means they are sending more soldiers and some big ships to that part of the world.

Now, why would they do that? It's not to start a fight. It's like when a big brother or sister stands close by when you are having a serious talk with someone. They are there to show that they are serious about the conversation and to help everyone feel safe.

America is sending these soldiers to show how important these talks are. They want to make sure that the leaders keep talking and find a way to agree. It's about being strong and showing that they really care about finding a good solution for everyone, not about making trouble. They want to protect people and make sure everyone follows the rules of the deal if one is made.

*   **Did you know?** Soldiers also help people in many other ways, like helping after big floods or storms, or even building schools and roads in some places!

### Talking and Waiting

Mr. Trump said there were about "10 days" to see if a deal could be made. That means they have a special time to try and talk a lot and agree. It's like having a deadline for a school project. You have to finish it by a certain day.

When leaders talk, it's called "negotiations." It means they sit down, share their ideas, and listen carefully to each other. They try to find solutions that work for everyone. Sometimes it takes a long time, and sometimes it's hard. But talking is always better than not talking.

We all hope that leaders can talk things through and make good choices. We want them to agree on ways to keep the world safe and peaceful. Just like we learn to share and be kind in school, countries need to learn to share and be kind to each other too.

*   **Did you know?** There is a special building in New York City called the United Nations, where leaders from almost all countries in the world come together to talk about peace and safety for everyone!

### We All Hope for Peace

So, what does all this mean for us? It means that people everywhere, including here in Africa, want the world to be a safe and happy place. We want countries to be friends and work together.

Leaders are working hard to make sure special energy is used for good things, like making light for homes and not for scary weapons. They are talking, talking, talking to make a good agreement.

We can all hope for peace. We can learn to be kind to our friends and family, and help solve problems by talking. That's a great way to start making the world a more peaceful place, right here where we live.

Thank you for listening, super friends! Stay curious and keep hoping for a safe and happy world!
summary: Leaders from America and Iran are talking about a special kind of energy to make sure it's used for good things like electricity, not for powerful weapons, hoping to agree on a deal to keep everyone safe.
whyMatters: This is important because when big countries talk and agree, it helps keep the whole world, including our homes in Africa, safe and peaceful, so we can all play and learn without worries.

originalTitle: Managing Man Utd the 'ultimate role' - Carrick
title: Super Soccer News: A Young Star Shines!
content:
Welcome, Football Friends!

Hello, amazing kids! Welcome to our special news show from Africa! Today, we have some exciting football news to share. It's all about big dreams, teamwork, and a very talented young player. Are you ready for some super news about football? Football is a game many of us love to play and watch. It's all about kicking a ball, scoring goals, and working together as a team. Today, we are talking about a big football club far away, called Manchester United. They are a famous team that plays in England.

What is Football Anyway?

Football, or soccer as some call it, is a game where two teams try to kick a ball into the other team's net. The team that scores more goals wins! You mostly use your feet, not your hands, to play. It's fun to run around, pass the ball, and try your best. Many children, just like you, play football every day! It makes you strong and happy. Did you know? The first rules for football were made a very, very long time ago in England!

Meet Manchester United!

Imagine a really, really big football club. That's Manchester United! They wear red shirts, and many people all over the world love them. They have many amazing players who train very hard. These players work together to win big games and trophies. A trophy is like a special prize for winning! Did you know? Many famous African football players have also played in big leagues, just like Manchester United's league!

Who is Michael Carrick?

Now, let's meet a special person named Michael Carrick. He used to be a fantastic football player for Manchester United himself! He was very good at passing the ball and helping his team. Now, he helps the team in a different way. He is helping to lead them. Did you know? Michael Carrick played over 300 games for Manchester United! That's a lot of games!

A Special Job: Caretaker Manager

Michael Carrick has a special job right now. He is called a 'caretaker manager.' What does that mean? Imagine if your teacher had to go away for a little while. Another teacher would come to look after your class until the first teacher came back, or a new teacher arrived. That's what a caretaker manager does! He takes care of the team for a short time, making sure they play well and are ready for their games. It's a very important job because he guides all the players. He helps the players know what to do on the field. He picks who will play and tells them the best way to win. It takes a lot of thinking and planning to be a good manager.

Meet Our Young Star: Kobbie Mainoo!

Now for the super exciting part! There's a brilliant young player named Kobbie Mainoo. He is a 'huge talent.' This means he is very, very good at football, even though he is still young! He plays in the middle of the field, helping to get the ball from one end to the other. People are very excited about him because he is so clever with the ball. Kobbie is a young boy, not much older than some of your big brothers or sisters. But he plays like a grown-up professional! He trains every single day to get better and better. He wants to be the best football player he can be.

What is an 'Academy'?

Kobbie Mainoo came from something called an 'academy.' What's an academy? It's like a special school for young football players! Big clubs like Manchester United have these academies. They find young boys and girls who love football and are very good at it. Then, they teach them how to play even better. They help them with their skills, like dribbling, passing, and shooting. It's a place where young dreams start! So, Kobbie is an 'academy graduate' because he grew up learning to play football right there at Manchester United's special school. He worked very hard for many years, learning all the tricks and rules of the game. Did you know? Many of the best football players in the world started in academies when they were very small children!

Why Trust Young Players?

Michael Carrick, the caretaker manager, is talking about 'trusting' Kobbie. What does 'trusting' mean here? It means he believes in Kobbie. He believes that Kobbie is good enough to play with the older, more experienced players. It means he believes Kobbie can help the team win, even though he is young. It's a big deal when a manager trusts a young player because it means that young player will get to play in important games. It takes courage for a manager to put a young player in a big game. But when they see someone as talented as Kobbie, they know it's the right thing to do. They want to give him a chance to show everyone how good he is. Did you know? When young players get a chance to play, it makes them feel very proud and makes them want to work even harder!

Playing Together as a Team

Football is all about teamwork. Even if you are a super-talented player like Kobbie, you need your teammates. Everyone has to work together, pass the ball, help each other, and celebrate together. Michael Carrick knows this very well. He wants all the players, young and old, to play as one big happy team. When everyone trusts each other and works together, great things can happen. It's like when you play with your friends. You all help each other to have fun and make sure everyone gets a turn.

Dreams Come True!

For a young player like Kobbie Mainoo, getting to play for Manchester United is like a dream come true! He has worked so hard for many years. Now, he gets to wear the famous red shirt and play in front of many fans. This story tells us that if you work hard, practice, and believe in yourself, your dreams can come true too! It's a wonderful message for all of us. Did you know? Many African children dream of becoming famous football players, and some of them make it happen!

Keep Kicking!

So, remember the names Michael Carrick and Kobbie Mainoo. One is a kind manager who believes in young talent, and the other is a bright young star living his dream. Next time you kick a ball, remember their story. Keep practicing, keep playing, and keep dreaming big! Maybe one day, we will be writing news about you!
